intro: Bedfordia linearis var. curvifolia, commonly known as the curving linear bedfordia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage. The plant features small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade, making it a suitable ornamental for woodland gardens. Its compact growth habit and attractive foliage make it a valuable addition to native plant landscapes.
